intro: Hieracium triangulare subsp. alternidens, commonly known as the three-lobed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring alternate, lanceolate leaves with serrated margins. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by radiating petals, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypselae. It thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies.
